thread.title: Cholera kills hundreds in South Sudan, 5000 children at risk
thread.title_full: Cholera kills hundreds in South Sudan, 5000 children at risk

author: eTN Managing Editor
title: Cholera kills hundreds in South Sudan, 5000 children at risk
text:
Cholera kills hundreds in South Sudan, 5000 children at risk Adv: 
Jul 03, 2015 Adv: 
It's a human disaster in this new East African country. A total of 484 cholera cases, including 29 deaths - six of them children under five - had been reported by the end of June in South Sudan, the U.N. Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (UNOCHA) said. 
At least 29 people have died in a cholera outbreak in war-torn South Sudan with thousands more at risk of infection, the United Nations said Friday. 5000 children under the age of five are at risk of dying. 
The World Health Organization (WHO) and aid workers are carrying out cholera vaccination campaigns. South Sudan's health ministry declared a outbreak of the disease on June 23, when the number killed hit 18. 
The outbreak is believed to have begun in early June in crowded UN bases in the capital Juba and then spread to other parts of the city. 
Over 140,000 people have sought shelter in U.N. camps across the country during 18 months of civil war
